intro: Sesuvium, commonly known as sea pink, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. Sesuvium species are adapted to withstand salt spray and high temperatures, making them resilient to harsh maritime conditions. Their unique morphology and ecological adaptations make them an important component of coastal ecosystems.
